text: celebrations here in central athens at
sierra's election headquarters people
jubilant they'd won by a much bigger
margin than opinion polls have predicted
for the party leader Alexis tsipras
who'd called the snap election after
stepping down as prime minister last
month it was a moment to savor he
described it as a people's victory yes
clearly give this girl a murky I want to
thank you from the bottom of my heart
for this great victory I feel vindicated
because the Greek people gave us a clear
mandate to continue the struggle to
raise up our people's dignity but syriza
did not get enough votes for an outright
majority in parliament so it's having to
form a coalition with a small right wing
anti-austerity party which will give it
a majority of just five seats it was a
particularly disappointing night for
vangelis may Marcus the leader of the
Conservative Party new democracy which
had appeared to be running neck-and-neck
with syriza although voters have given
syriza a clear mandate to govern again
the turnout was a record low a measure
of people's deep disappointment with all
the country's political parties which is
so far failed to bring an end to the
long painful economic crisis
